intro: Pyrrosia shennongensis, commonly known as the Shennong Mountains fern, is a rare and endemic species native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, leathery fronds with a distinctive, intricate venation pattern. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates in humid, shaded environments, showcasing its adaptability to challenging ecological conditions. Its spores are dispersed by wind, contributing to its limited distribution. Due to its restricted habitat and threats from habitat destruction, it is considered a vulnerable species in conservation efforts.
